page.title: 14FARMING - DEER
page.content: June. Red deer calves are born in June and are tagged in the ear with the date and name of the estate to find out where they move to. Some have roamed as far as Fort William and swum across Loch Ericht to Rannoch. The calves are weak at birth and cannot follow their mothers. They are hidden within seeing and hearing distance but they have a tendency to follow human beings. July. The lower slopes of the hills have to be covered with fertilizer, new bridges, roads and culverts are to be built if their is money available. Tractors, Land Rovers and ponies are used for this work. At this time of year roe deer can be seen in the woods, never on the bare hillside. There are 4 or 5 wild goats on the estate and the protected pine martens are abundant.
